#Text=Canada 's Scarborough-Agincourt ( Ward 39 ) city council candidates speak
#Text=Friday , November 3 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Torontonians will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Scarborough-Agincourt ( Ward 39 ) .
#Text=Two candidates responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Wayne Cook , Mike Del Grande ( incumbent ) , Samuel Kung , Lushan Lu , Sunshine Smith , and John Wong .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Wayne Cook
#Text=51-year-old Wayne Cook is a business consultant , regarding trade in China .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :
#Text=Crime :
#Text=I support Mayor Miller 's record , by adding 450 new Police Officers in the City , during the past 3 years .
#Text=Further , as Ward 39 Councillor , I would work with Mayor Miller to add another 600 new Police Officers , over the next 4 year term .
#Text=As a Council , we need to create recreation and job training opportunities hat help divert youth away from gang culture .
#Text=This is our " Community Safety Plan " .

column1: #Text=Traffic Congestion/Public Transit : We need to make an investment into public transit and alternative ways to get around our city ( bike , walking , etc. ) .
#Text=TTC service must be improved to provide an alternative to cars .
#Text=Parking : Locally , I will work with Council , to remove driveway barriers , which serve no real purpose .
#Text=Also , I do not support " Speed Humps " , as proposed on Canongate .
#Text=Finally , families who choose to rent out a basement apartment , should not be harassed by being identified as a " Rooming House " .
#Text=True " Rooming Houses " need to be removed , but within the legal definition .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A : Locally , traffic congestion , TTC service and driveway parking is the related issue raised most during our canvassing .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : In my community , there is a sense that our neighbourhoods have deteriorated , over the past 3 years .
#Text=I want to work with the community to turn this situation around .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A :
#Text=This has been my home for 14 years .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A : From 2004-2005 , I was an intern in the Hon. Jim Karygiannis M.P. 's office in Scarborough-Agincourt .
#Text=During that time , I was involved in community work in the Heathwood Community and on the traffic congestion issues on Steeles .
#Text=For many years , I have been a volunteer with the Heathwood Ratepayers Association , delivering newsletters in our community .
#Text=In 1997 , I raised the issue that two residents had been killed , because there was no Railway Crossing at Passmore .
#Text=After many weeks of canvassing door to door , the M.P. , M.P.P. and City Councillors agreed to erect a Rail Way Crossing .
#Text=Over my 14 years in our community , I have been active in a number of initiatives related to the environment , bikes paths , walking trails , saving trees slated to be chopped down , etc.
#Text=Q : What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=A : Toronto means " Meeting Place " and this is true , as we are the home to so many people , from so many countries around the world .
#Text=Q : Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=A : Proud : Decision to invest in new subway cars , which are made in Canada .
#Text=Least Desirable : A local issue related to removing street parking , which has resulted in front yard parking on grassy areas .
#Text=Q : If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=A : I will listen to the community , NOT just send messages from City Hall .
#Text=I want to see community driven solutions .
#Text=Mike Del Grande ( incumbent )
#Text=52-year-old Mike Del Grande is the incumbent for this ward .
#Text=Q : Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A : Crime : This community has experienced a significant increase in violent crime .
#Text=In addition , the number of unreported crimes is an issue .
#Text=A number of constituents have told me that they have been victims but have been too afraid or ashamed to report it .
#Text=Traffic :
#Text=Everyone wants speed humps as motorists are becoming more irresponsible with excessive speeds .
#Text=City Services : A general unhappiness with the level of service for the taxes paid .
#Text=Q : What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A : The decay of the City is very self evident whether it be with crime , garbage/litter or general state of City services .
#Text=Residents are frustrated that taxes get increased but no noticeable improvement seen .
#Text=Q : Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=A : As a 23 year resident and volunteer , it becomes evident that the same old gang at City Hall have not succeeded in their stewardship of the City .
#Text=I want to use my experience and talents to try to break a log jam at City Hall in the way we operate and the way we provide service to our residents .
#Text=Q : Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=A : I live here , I volunteer here , I own a home here and I want to see the area become a neighbourhood that people want to move to .
#Text=Q : How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A : Community Association co-president , Volunteer with local schools , past volunteer with Boy Scouts , Neighbourhood Watch , Block Parent .
#Text=Past School Trustee , Volunteer Treasurer with one of the local churches and Volunteer Teacher .
#Text=Q : What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=A : Toronto is where I was born and raised .
#Text=Toronto means being the envy of the world , prosperous , with safe neighourhoods , good transportation and a good business climate to create jobs and wealth .
#Text=Q : Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=A : Council decisions have been inconsistent and unfairly applied .
#Text=The Ward is happy that I take a tough stand to ensure sound management and policy practices .
#Text=Q : If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?
#Text=A : I am the incumbent " rookie councillor " .
#Text=What I brought and still bring is a passion to do the right thing in the right way for my ward and the rest of the City .
